meanings.definition: A compound found in certain plants that produces a soapy lather when mixed with water.
meanings.sent1: The saponine in the plant created bubbles when I added water.
meanings.sent2: She used saponine from the plant to make natural soap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the saponine for actual soap and tried to wash its paws with it.
meanings.sent4: The saponine worked like a charm, turning the water into a frothy cloud.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by how the saponine transformed the water into a bubbly potion.

meanings.definition: Any of various plant compounds that have a soap-like action.
meanings.sent1: The herbalist explained the benefits of using saponine in cleaning products.
meanings.sent2: Farmers have been using saponine as a natural alternative to chemical detergents.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that saponine was so good at cleaning, it could even wash away bad luck.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a saponine effect, cleansing his mind of doubts.
meanings.sent5: The saponine properties of the plant extract made it a popular ingredient in eco-friendly soaps.
